protocol_name: Genotype with Quant Studio™ 12K Flex protocol
protocol_name_html: Genotype with Quant Studio™ 12K Flex protocol
protocol_affiliation: Shandong Provincial Hospital for Skin Diseases, Shandong University,Shandong Provincial Hospital for Skin Diseases
manuscript_citation: Wang N, Wang Z, Wang C, Fu X, Yu G, Yue Z, Liu T, Zhang H, Li L, Chen M, Wang H, Niu G, Liu D, Zhang M, Xu Y, Zhang Y, Li J, Li Z, You J, Chu T, Li F, Liu D, Liu H, Zhang F (2018) Prediction of leprosy in the Chinese population based on a weighted genetic risk score. PLoS Negl Trop Dis 12(9): e0006789. doi: 10.1371/journal.pntd.0006789
authors: Na Wang,Chuan Wang,Xi'an Fu,Gongqi Yu,Zhenhua Yue,Tingting Liu

authors_list.name: Na Wang

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"ble4g","text":"Extract high-molecular-weight genomic DNA was from 2 ml venous blood using the QuickGene 610L Automatic DNA\/RNA Extraction System (Fijifilm, Tokyo, Japan).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4mfme","text":"The quantitative detection of gDNA by NanoDrop 8000, the ratio of ultraviolet (UV) spectrophotometer readings at 260 nm and 280 nm wavelengths should be between 1.7 and 2.0 (i.e., A260\/A280 = 1.7-2.0).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1jpa9","text":"Normalize all gDNA samples so that each through\u2010hole receives the same input quantity of sample. Standardization of the gDNA to 96\u2010well sample plate with double-distilled water and the quantity of starting material is 10 \u03bcL at a concentration of 30 ng\/\u03bcl.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1sike","text":"30 independent SNPs derived from genome-wide association studies (S1 Table), were customized by Thermo Fisher Scientific company, USA. Custom TaqMan\u00ae Assay Design Tool was used for Custom Assays design, the following is the website: https:\/\/www.thermofisher.com\/order\/custom-genomic-products\/ tools\/genotyping\/. Plate setup files (*.tpf or *.spf) contain the assay information for individual TaqMan\u00aeOpenArray\u00ae plates, including the gene symbol, gene name, assay ID, and location ofeach assay on the plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":233,"length":77,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https:\/\/www.thermofisher.com\/order\/custom-genomic-products\/%20tools\/genotyping\/"}}]}
steps.section: Assay design and chip ordering by Thermo Fisher

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"a1bso","text":"Track the samples","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":17,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eiut","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ejikk","text":"Create a sample information file (*.csv) to track where the samples are in the96\u2010well sample plate. The OpenArray\u00ae Sample Tracker Software automatically maps the sample locations from the 96\u2010well reaction plates to the appropriate locations in the 384\u2010well sample plates and TaqMan\u00ae OpenArray\u00ae plates. Then export the sample information in table format (*.csv).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
steps.section: Perform the Quant Studio™ 12K Flex system

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"enjjl","text":"Prepare the PCR mix and 384\u2010well sample plate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":45,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3jrrt","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a5m7g","text":"a) Thaw the 96\u2010well reaction plate containing prepared gDNA samples at room temperature. Mix the gDNA samples by vortexing, then spin for 1 minute @ 1000 rpm.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"408j1","text":"b) Mix the 2\u2715TaqMan\u00ae OpenArray\u00ae Genotyping Master Mix by gently invertingthe bottle 10 times.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1qgp2","text":"c) Add the master mix 2 \u03bcL to the 384\u2010well sample plate.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e29oq","text":"d) Using a 12\u2010channel pipette, transfer the normalized gDNA samples 2 \u03bcL from the96\u2010well reaction plate to the 384\u2010well sample plate. Cover the sample plate with foil, then centrifuge for 1minute @ 1000 rpm to eliminate bubbles.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
steps.section: Perform the Quant Studio™ 12K Flex system

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"8p0le","text":"Prepare the QuantStudio\u2122 12K Flex OpenArray\u00ae Plate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":50,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"agi1i","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5pf54","text":"Transfer the samples from 384-well sample plate to TaqMan\u00a8 OpenArray\u00a8 plates using the QuantStudio\u2122 OpenArray\u00a8 AccuFill\u2122 System.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b39t8","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"161tf","text":"a) Confirm that the OpenArray\u00ae 384\u2010well sample plate, OpenArray\u00ae AccuFill\u2122System Loader Tips, and plate holder are completely ready and put in the right place.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9sobj","text":"b) Remove an OpenArray\u00ae plate from the freezer, and put in the room temperature for 10 mins.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bajhj","text":"c) Prepare a syringe containing OpenArray\u00ae Immersion Fluid and attach the tip to the syringe.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c0j6q","text":"d) Close the enclosure door, then start the QuantStudio\u2122 OpenArray\u00ae AccuFill\u2122Software. When the Remove OpenArray\u00ae Plate window appears, open the instrument door, carefully remove the indicated OpenArray\u00ae plate, then immediately seal the plate with OpenArray\u00ae Case Lid and Load the OpenArray\u00ae case with OpenArray\u00ae Immersion Fluid.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
steps.section: Perform the Quant Studio™ 12K Flex system

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"8hsgt","text":"Load the OpenArray\u00ae plate into the instrument and run the OpenArray\u00ae plates","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ec9gh","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dfbf6","text":"a) Place the OpenArray\u00ae plate(s) on the plate adapter. Make sure that: Each plate is properly aligned in the adapter, and the plate barcode is facing up and toward the front of the instrument.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4fk2d","text":"b) Click 'Get Plate IDs' to import the barcode of the OpenArray\u00ae plates that wewant to run. The barcode of those OpenArray\u00ae plates will be populated and matched.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9gluu","text":"c) Perform the Quant Studio 12K Flex platform instrument run. Temperature conditions were 10 min at 93 \u00b0C; cycling for 45 s at 95 \u00b0C, 13 s at 94 \u00b0C, and 2 min at 53.5 \u00b0C for 50 cycles, followed by incubation at 25 \u00b0C for 2 minutes.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
steps.section: Perform the Quant Studio™ 12K Flex system

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"7juj3","text":"After an experiment run, close the run and re\u2010open the *.eds file to display the Allelic Discrimination Plot screen. Then integrate the Sample names and Assay IDs into the resulting *.eds file.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6sql","text":"Export the experiments results to anther computer. Analyze the experiment results with Taqman genotype analyzer v1.3.1.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8q014","text":"Review the flags in the QC Summary, such as NOSIGNAL, NOAMP, OFFSCALE and et al.   The flags BADROX and AMPSCORE are, by default, were not in use for the Genotyping experiment, need us manually remove these samples. View and, if necessary, change the analysis settings and Click Edit Default Settings, then specify the default call settings.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6hfn9","text":"Export the analyzed data and select QuantStudio\u2122 12K Flex format (*.csv) for further analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
